title: Stack overflow in XML Parsing
content:
Summary:
A stack buffer overflow vulnerability has been detected in XML parsing functionality on Notepad++.
That's due to the fact that _invisibleEditView.getText function doesn't check buffer boundaries.
Description:
Vulnerability src file: notepad-plus-plus/PowerEditor/src/Notepad_plus.cpp
Vulnerability line: line 1008
Variable affected: char encodingStr[128];
Function that overflows buffer: _invisibleEditView.getText
Steps To Reproduce:
Create a .xml file with a correct XML format
Introduce a big XML field that overflows "encodingStr" buffer.
Open the file with Notepad++ and application should crash.
Supporting Material/References:
BoF_example1.xml -> Exploit example
Impact
An attacker could create a malicious .xml file that triggers a stack buffer overflow on victim machine.
You only need to open attached .xml file example with Notepad++ to reproduce the exploit.
steps: Create a .xml file with a correct XML format but include a large XML field that exceeds the 128-byte buffer of 'encodingStr'.
Open the malicious .xml file with Notepad++ to trigger the stack buffer overflow and crash the application.
vuln_description: A stack buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Notepad++ during XML parsing due to insufficient boundary checks in the '_invisibleEditView.getText' function when handling large XML fields, leading to a crash when a crafted XML file is opened.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward buffer overflow scenario with no complex interactions or state manipulations required. The attacker only needs to craft a file with a specific size constraint, making the discovery process relatively simple.
